item.name: Fulgurite
entries: A natural glass formed when lightning strikes sand, fusing the grains into a glassy tube. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Kyanite
entries: A blue silicate mineral made under high pressure. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Petrified Wood
entries: A piece of wood that has turned to stone over the ages. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Primordial Focus
entries: A primordial focus is the result of extreme elemental force, such as a piece of kyanite, fulgurite, pumice stone, tektite, or petrified wood. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

items: {@item Kyanite|TCP}
{@item Fulgurite|TCP}
{@item Pumice Stone|TCP}
{@item Tektite|TCP}
{@item Petrified Wood|TCP}

item.name: Pumice Stone
entries: A light, porous volcanic rock formed when lava cools quickly. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Tektite
entries: A natural glass formed when a meteorite strikes the earth, fusing the surrounding soil into a glassy mass. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

subclassFeature.name: Branded Warrior Spells
entries: At 3rd level, you lean an additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Branded Warrior Spells table. The spells counts as Conduit spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Conduit spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Blazing Combatant
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn Emblems that are fueled by special dice called heat dice

entries.name: Emblems
entries: You learn the Emblems listed below under "Emblems". Many Emblems enhance an attack in some way. You can only use one Emblem per attack

entries.name: Heat Dice
entries: You have a number of heat dice equal to your proficiency bonus, which are {@dice d8}s. A heat die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended heat dice when you finish a short or long rest.

The power of your heat burns brightest at the start of combat, but weans over time. Heat dice diminish in the following sequence: {@dice d8}, {@dice d6}, {@dice d4}. At the start of each of your turns, yous heat die diminishes to the next die in the sequence, down to a minimum of {@dice d4}.
Your maximum heat die increases to a {@dice d10} at 10th level and {@dice d12} at 18th level.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some of your Emblems require your target to make a saving throw to resist the Emblem's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Branded Warrior
entries: It's getting toasty in here eh?

subclassFeature.name: Emblems
entries: The Emblems are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: Familiar Flame
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain resistance to fire damage. Additionally, while you are concentrating on a spell that deals fire damage, you gain a bonus to any Constitution saving throws you make to maintain concentration on that spell. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Blaze
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you cast a spell that deals fire damage your Heat of Battle increases by an amount equal to the level of the spell cast.

subclassFeature.name: Ring of Fire
entries: Starting at 15th level, as an action you may ignite a ring of fire centered on a point you can see within 30 feet. The flames burn 10 feet high and 5 feet wide in a 15 foot radius, and last for a minute. Creatures that come into contact with the flames suffer one of the following effects until the end of your next turn.

items: A creature that is immune to fire damage becomes resistant
A creature that is resistant to fire damage has its resistance ignored
All other creatures become vulnerable to fire damage

entries: You can only have one ring active at a time. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. Alternatively, you may reduce your Heat of Battle by 6 to use the ability again.

subclassFeature.name: Overheat
entries: Starting at 17th level you gain the ability to overheat and burn at new exciting heights. Your Heat of Battle now increases by 3 at the start of your turn instead of 1.

subclassFeature.name: Grasp of the Protector
entries: At 3rd level, you may use your action to try to select a target within 30 feet. That target must make a dexterity saving throw or be grappled until the start of your next turn. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses on a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Spells
entries: At 3rd level, you lean an additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Guardian Spells table. The spells counts as Conduit spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Conduit spells you know.

entries.caption: Guardian Spells
rows: {@spell Freedom of Movement}, {@spell Wall of Fire}

subclassFeature.name: Guardian
entries: Guardians harness the power of Cold energy to empower and defend themselves and their allies.

subclassFeature.name: Warding Pillars
entries: At 3rd level you learn how to create and shape the elements to hinder your foes and assist your allies. You gain an amount of Pillars equal to your prof bonus and regain all uses on a short or long rest

As a bonus action you can create any number of pillars up to the amount you have available at points you can see within 60 feet. Each pillar can be either 5 ft tall, 10 feet thick and 10 ft wide or 10 ft tall and 5 feet thick and 5 ft wide. The pillars all have HP equal to 5 times your level in this class, are immune to Cold, Psychic, and Poison damage, and an AC of 14. You can move a pillar up to 20 feet on your turn as a bonus action. The pillars last for up to a hour, after which they melt harmlessly into the ground.

Additionally, when a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, and you are within 30 feet of a pillar, you may use your reaction to have that pillar take a portion of the damage. Select an amount up to your Conduit level plus your Wisdom modifier, and not more then the pillar's HP. The pillar takes that amount of damage, and the targeted creature takes the remainder.

subclassFeature.name: Heal and Hinder
entries: Starting at level 6, your Warding Pillars provide protection to your allies. If an allied creature comes within 10 feet of a pillar, they gain temp HP equal to your Wisdom modifier. Additionally, a 10 foot radius around your pilliar is difficult terrain for creatures of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Shattering Pillars
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can coat enemies in an elemental primer. As an action you can pick a Pillar you can see and cause it to explode. All enemies in a 15-foot-radius of the pillar must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is primed. The next attack against that creature has advantage, and deals an additional {@damage 4d6} damage.

subclassFeature.name: Imprison
entries: At 18th level, you learn to encase your foes in your Warding Pillars. When you create your Warding Pillars, you can now choose to create them in a creature's space. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, the creature is grappled and restrained as they become encased in your Icy Pillar. A creature may repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns. On a successful save the creature is freed and moved to the next closest open space to the pillar.

subclassFeature.name: Protector's Embrace
entries: You gain the benefits of your pillars. Write this better later.

subclassFeature.name: Primeval Soul Spells
entries: At 3rd level, you lean an additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Branded Warrior Spells table. The spells counts as Conduit spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Conduit spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Primeval Soul
entries: Primeval Souls have studied storms and the power of lightning, using it to empower their speed and lethality.

subclassFeature.name: Energy Surge
entries: At 3rd level you harness the energy around you to move fast and strike hard. As a bonus action, you may take a stance for up to a minute. You choose a stance each time you use this feature, and can switch between stances for the duration as a bonus action.

items: Your movement speed increases by 10ft
You gain a fly speed equal to your movement speed. At the end of each of your turns, you will begin to plummet
During your turn, if you make a melee attack against a creature, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.
Your movement speed decreases by 10ft
You gain a +1 bonus to your AC

When you hit with a weapon attack, you may force the target to make a Strength saving throw. The DC for this save is 8 + Wisdom modifier + Proficiency Bonus. On a failed save, you either force the target away from you 5ft, or knock them prone.

entries: You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus regaining all uses on long rest

subclassFeature.name: Accelerated Reflexes
entries: Beginning at 6th level, your excess energy improves your reflexes. You have advantage on initiative checks.

Additionally, when a hostile creature within 30 feet of you makes an attack against a target other than you, you may use your reaction to move up to your movement speed without provoking attacks of opportunity, and make a weapon attack against the attacking creature. You may react in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses on a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: TBD
entries: TBD

subclassFeature.name: TBD
entries: TBD

subclassFeature.name: TBD
entries: TBD

classFeature.name: Primordial Knowledge
entries: Your understanding of the primordial forces that power you has augmented your mind. At first level, you learn the {@language Primordial} language if you don't already know it.

classFeature.name: Primordial Creation
entries: At 1st level, your knowledge and experience with primordial energy aids you in everyday life. Over the course of a minute, you may create or manipulate Acid, Fire, Ice, Thunder and Lightning for up to an hour in the following ways.

items: You may create a small pool of acid to slowly corrode a metal
You may set a flammable object on fire
You may freeze an area of water or create a small amount of ice
You may create a thunderclap audible from 100 feet away
You may shoot a bolt of lightning harmlessly into the air

entries: The effects end if stopped by normal means, such as putting water on a fire, when you dismiss them, or when an hour has passed. You might be able to achieve something beyond the scope of the above examples. State your desired effect to the DM as precisely as possible. All effects must fall within the following confines.

items: You cannot effect an area greater than 1 cubic foot
The cannot directly effect a creature

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Energy Imbuement
entries: When you reach 2nd level, you may empower your damage with one of the following "imbuement damage types":

items: Acid
Cold
Fire
Lightning
Thunder

entries: As a bonus action, you may expend a spell slot to activate this power. While Energy Imbuement is active, your weapon attacks deal extra damage once per turn for the next minute. Expending a 1st level spell slot allows you to add your Wisdom modifier to the damage. A 2nd level slot additionally adds {@damage 1d4} damage, with an additional {@damage 1d4} for each level above 2nd. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, your imbuement immediately ends.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By the time you reach 2nd level, you have learned to use primordial energy to cast spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter conduit spell list|spells|level=0|class=Conduit (TCP)}. You learn additional conduit cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Conduit table.
When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one conduit cantrip you know with another cantrip from the conduit spell list.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Conduit table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter conduit spells|spells|class=Conduit (TCP)}. To cast one of your conduit spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of conduit spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the {@filter conduit spell list|spells|class=Conduit (TCP)}. When you do so, choose a number of conduit spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + half your conduit level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level conduit, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 14, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd-level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell burning hands}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of conduit spells requires time spent in meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Conduit spells, since your magic draws upon your conection to the primordial forces around you. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Conduit spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item primordial focus|TCP} as a spellcasting focus for your conduit spells.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity
entries: At 3rd level, you choose an focus to augment your abilities. Choose one of the options detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, 15th, and 17th level.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility
entries: {@i 4th-level conduit {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you may replace a fighting style you know with another fighting style available to conduits.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature based on your Energy Affinity.

classFeature.name: Imbued Defense
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you use the Energy Imbuement feature you may choose an imbuement damage type to gain resistance to for the duration of your Energy Imbuement.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature based on your Energy Affinity.

classFeature.name: Borrowed Power
entries: At 11th level you may call upon the power of elementals as an action. Each time you use this ability, choose one of the following. If an ability requires a saving throw, the DC is 8 + Wisdom modifier + Proficiency Bonus. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Gouts of molten lava erupt from your body. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on yourself must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage and {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half as much damage.

entries.name: Earth
entries: One creature of your choice within 30 feet must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage and has the {@condition blinded} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Water
entries: You magically shoot water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 20 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the cold damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Air
entries: A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point you can see within 60 feet of you. The whirlwind lasts as long as you maintain {@status concentration} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any creature other than you that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by it. You can move the whirlwind up to 20 feet as an action, and creatures {@condition restrained} by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if you lose sight of it.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sure Footed
entries: Starting at 14th level, your connection to the earth beneath you is strengthened. While you are standing on solid ground, you cannot be forcefully moved against your will, and you have advantage on saves against being knocked prone. Additionally, you gain tremorsense out to a range of 60 feet.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature based on your Energy Affinity.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature based on your Energy Affinity.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Chosen of the Elementals
entries: Atop the hierarchy of elementals lies the {@creature Leviathan|MPMM}, {@creature Zaratan|MPMM}, {@creature Phoenix|MPMM}, and {@creature Elder Tempest|MPMM}. At 20th level, each of these legendary creatures recognizes your power, and has granted you a boon. If a boon requires a saving throw, the DC is 8 + Wisdom modifier + Proficiency Bonus.

entries.name: Leviathan
entries: As an action, you create a wave of water that extends from a point you can see within 120. The wave is up to 250 feet long, up to 250 feet tall, and up to 50 feet wide. Each hostile creature in the wave must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 7d12} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The water spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 250 feet of it, and then it vanishes. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

entries.name: Zaratan
entries: As an action, you conjure a shell of rock. Until the start of your next turn, you are resistant to all damage and are {@condition restrained}. At the start of your next turn, you regain {@dice 8d10} hit points and are no longer {@condition restrained}. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

entries.name: Phoenix
entries: When you die, your body explodes into a burst of flame. Each hostile creature in a 60-foot-radius around you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Instead of dying, you are restored to life with half of your hit point maximum. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

entries.name: Elder Tempest
entries: Each hostile creature within 120 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

macro.name: Energy Imbuement

optionalfeature.name: Burning Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a heat die to deal additional fire damage equal to the number rolled on your heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Fiery Precision
entries: When you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can expend one heat to add it to the roll. You can use this emblem before or after making the attack roll, but before any effects of the attack are applied.

optionalfeature.name: Flare
entries: When you take the attack action, you may expend a heat die and use a bonus action to throw a dart of fire at a target you can see within 60 feet of you. The dart is a ranged weapon attack with which you are proficient, and the damage is equal to the number rolled on your heat die plus your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Radiating Presence
entries: You can expend one heat die and use a bonus action to coat yourself in flame for 1 minute. During this time, you radiate 10 feet of bright light and 10 feet of dim light.
Additionally, when you use this emblem, roll the expended heat die. Any hostile creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of your takes damage equal to the number rolled on your current heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Revenge of the Pyre
entries: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one heat die to deal damage equal to the number rolled to the attacking creature.

optionalfeature.name: Rocket Jump
entries: As a bonus action, you may expend a heat die to improve your jumping ability. When you do so, your jumping distance is doubled for the remainder of your turn.

default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
